question.text:
A set of 6 test tubes having same temperature but different pH were setup to conduct an experiment. To each of the tubes, starch and amylase were added in a mix of sterile water. The concentration was kept the same. The following table notes the reaction completion time for each of the six tubes.
 
pH 1 3 5 7 9 11
Time taken to complete in seconds(s). 94 64 32 5 35 66

Using the above data, determine the pH where amylase has shown highest rate of activity.

solution.text: Enzymes are biocatalyst that help in speeding up the reaction rate exponentially. Temperature,  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math> , substrate concentration are few of the factors that affect the activity of the enzyme. These molecules shows highest activity work in a particular  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>  called as optimum  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math> . Below or above that pH range the enzyme activity will reduce or become inactive. Since the enzyme amylase took least time to break starch in the range of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>7</mn></math>  compared to other pH values, it is showing highest activity at pH  <math><mn>7</mn></math> . Thus, pH  <math><mn>7</mn></math>  is the optimum  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math> .
